context_messages.content:
A beacon app that integrates with the Distributed Spatial Internet Graph (DSIG) infrastructure to support relays aggregating worlds and user status within world. See https://docs.zesty.xyz/graph/overview for more information.

The beacon information is aggregated and currently results in 100+ people per day seeing the world connected to the directory.

Additionally, there is a GitHub with custom SDK and more technical information beyond the Beacon Hyperfy core (app)  (https://github.com/zestyxyz/beacon).

Publisher: Zesty
Contact: <@749326744238030929>

So far this is great, wanted to also add that getting on our Relay will bring about 100 people per day to see your world on our directory, and the changes <@297290503181959169> pushed are on top of what we already have on GitHub over at https://github.com/zestyxyz/beacon
updated hopefully I did it justice 🫡

message_content_raw:
Butterfly swarm for Hyperfy V2


Today i made version 3, the flying behavior is now better (pretty and random) 
I added UI inputs for:

Butterfly amount
Random butterfly scale min/max
Random wingflap-speed min/max
Random fly-speed min/max

I would like to have the possibility for people to upload their own ‘butterfly wing .png (not sure if this is possible though)

For now, if you like to create your own version of a butterfly swarm, you can use this blender file (change_wing_image.blend) to change the image in the wing_tex material and export as glb

Then add the app version 3 to your world and change the model for your own.

Things i want to add in later versions:
- Toggle original glb on/off (so you can see where the center of the swarm is)
- have users upload their own wing image
- expose some more variables to the UI
- prevent the butterflies from flying under the ground plane

Have a fun weekend !

message_content_raw:
simple idea for a minigame I'm testing. Very work in progress 
"Simon Says" - it's not technically Simon Says, but a similar vibe. 

The screen displays a color, and players must jump to the correct block in time. In the final game, if they fail to do this, they would fall into a pit and die. 

The game would increase in difficulty by getting quicker, reducing the # of functioning colors in the arena, or shrinking the cube sizes. There's a whole bunch of variables that could be added. 

Eventually when there's one player remaining, the game would end. 

Next steps would be to add audio feedback, physics, and integrate with an HP system, like the one <@357905702926286858> created. There are also some issues with the way the colors are sent over to the playing area. It just grabs it from the local console I think 

This idea is inspired by a project <@783416470205497394>  is working on where various colored cubes are instanced.

```jsx
const mesh = app.get(‘mesh’)

mesh.onPointerLeave = () => mesh.scale.setScalar(1)
```

VRM is backwards in game. This happens in both Hyperfy v1, and v2. 
When the root bone pose is rotated 180 degrees it faces the correct direction, but the arms still rotate incorrectly.  
It does not happen in other VRM compatible apps like Unity, VRChat, Nifty Island, etc, so I believe this is unique to HyperFy.
https://github.com/hyperfy-xyz/hyperfy/issues/79

Instead of item based action bars like the Elemental system, this one is class based characters that have an avatar, skills, energy, etc.

Backpack will also be added, but those items will be more representational than the Elemental ones.

context_messages.content: and using the full strict mode on cloudflare

Today I've been experimenting with skinned meshes and have run into an interesting challenge. I have a simple 'leaf' mesh with a 40-frame animation where frame 1 shows the leaf completely straight and frame 40 shows it fully bent, with the in-between frames representing gradual transitions.

My goal is not to play the animation, but to use these 40 frames as 40 distinct states. For example, when creating a plant that has 10 of these leaves, each leaf could display a different state, unlocking a range of possibilities for generating a unique plant every time the app is added to the world.

I tried getting Cursor to generate code that would set the animation to a random frame and hold it there (without playing further), but no success, unfortunately. 

I made a little sketch to illustrate, Basically the generate button resembles a leaf app being added to the world and randomly choosing one of 40 frames to display.
https://cables.gl/p/Gc9siH

Any tips on the subject are highly appreciated : )
Cheers !

context: general hyper: and using the full strict mode on cloudflare

I have a simple 'leaf' mesh with a 40-frame animation where frame 1 shows the leaf completely straight and frame 40 shows it fully bent, with the in-between frames representing gradual transitions.

My goal is not to play the animation, but to use these 40 frames as 40 distinct states. For example, when creating a plant that has 10 of these leaves, each leaf could display a different state, unlocking a range of possibilities for generating a unique plant every time the app is added to the world.

I tried getting Cursor to generate code that would set the animation to a random frame and hold it there (without playing further), but no success, unfortunately. 

I made a little sketch to illustrate, Basically the generate button resembles a leaf app being added to the world and randomly choosing one of 40 frames to display.

Any tips on the subject are highly appreciated : )
Cheers !

context_messages.content:
when you get boneTransform, that is the "world" transform of the bone.
but your particles are attached to the app, so its adding the apps position on top of the world position of the bone
if you change `app.add(particles)` to `world.add(particles)` i think thats what you're looking for
also you can use `particles.position.setFromMatrixPosition(matrix)` instead of needing to read all the matrix values

aah that explains why when i the offset was bigger when i placed the app further away from the world center...
great, thank you, now it is right on top of the bone !

context:
ash: when you get boneTransform, that is the "world" transform of the bone.
but your particles are attached to the app, so its adding the apps position on top of the world position of the bone
ash: if you change `app.add(particles)` to `world.add(particles)` i think thats what you're looking for
ash: also you can use `particles.position.setFromMatrixPosition(matrix)` instead of needing to read all the matrix values

message_content_raw:
Here ya go <@722481129449586739> 

QuestItems with QuestItemUI with some basic configures.  

- Match the emit signals.  
- Can turn on and off persistant storage, if you want the count to carry over on world visits. Click Reset Count to clear storage key
-  Can just change the model in quest item and should work. 
-  Can turn on and off rotation and bobbing and change speed and height.
- Can click 'Reset Meshes' to bring back into world
-  Can check pixabay to find a different collection sound or just delete it if you don't want sound

-  Can rename Quest UI, switch for positioning on screen.  And scale the ui.  Change border width/color.  And text size/spacing.
- Can set ui to appear for a moment then go away until another collect, or always be on screen. 
- You can use the emit signal from the quest item to trigger anything in another hyp with world.on and the emit signal. 


This  should get you going.
